Of course! Rolling sushi tightly can take a bit of practice, but here are some tips to help:

1. Use the right amount of rice - Spread a thin, even layer of rice over the nori, leaving a bit of space at the top. Too much rice can make the roll bulky and hard to roll tightly.

2. Keep your hands and tools moist - Wet your hands and sushi mat or kitchen towel before rolling the sushi to prevent the rice from sticking to your hands.

3. Use just enough pressure - Use your fingers to press and shape the roll as you go, but don't press too hard, or the roll will become too compact and dense.

4. Roll gently - Roll the sushi mat or towel away from you, using gentle pressure to shape the roll as you go. Don't pull or tug too hard, or the filling may spill out the ends.

5. Use a sharp knife - A sharp knife will make clean, even slices without crushing the sushi. Dip the knife in water before slicing for extra moistness.

With some practice, you'll be able to roll sushi tightly and evenly every time. Good luck and enjoy!
